articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Iranian navy has taken delivery of cruise missiles with a range of 1,000 km (621 miles) as well as reconnaissance helicopters, state media reported on Sunday, as the U.S. accused Iran of a drone attack on a chemical tanker in the Indian ocean.
articles.title: Iran navy receives new cruise missiles amid growing regional tension

articles.author: Mahamat Ramadane
articles.description: Chadians have voted in favour of a new constitution that critics say could help cement the power of junta leader Mahamat Idriss Deby.
articles.title: Chad votes yes to new constitution backed by junta

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thirteen workers were killed and 38 were injured on Sunday in the explosion of a nickel smelter furnace owned by Indonesia Tsingshan Stainless Steel (ITSS) on Sulawesi island, the owner of the industrial park where the smelter is located said.
articles.title: Indonesia nickel smelter furnace blast kills 13 workers, wounds 38

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Large swaths of Australia on Sunday sweated through heat wave conditions as authorities warned of a high bushfire risk in many parts of the country's vast Western Australia state.
articles.title: Large parts of Australia endure heat wave, lifting bushfire risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain will deploy a naval ship off Guyana later this month, its ministry of defence said on Sunday, as the South American nation faces a border dispute with neighbour Venezuela over the oil-rich Essequibo region.
articles.title: UK to send naval ship to Guyana amid Venezuela border dispute

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Sunday that over the previous 24 hours it had detected eight Chinese fighter jets crossing over the median line of the Taiwan Strait, as well as one Chinese balloon.
articles.title: Taiwan says eight Chinese fighter jets crossed strait's median line

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel bombed areas of Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip overnight, with fighting throughout Sunday morning, residents and Palestinian media said, as the Israeli military announced a mounting death toll in clashes with Hamas militants.
articles.title: Israel bombs northern Gaza, reports mounting military losses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish farmers have ended their blockade of one of the border crossings between Ukraine and Poland and the movement of lorries has been fully restored, the Ukrainian border service said on Sunday.
articles.title: Trucks start crossing border after Polish farmers end blockade, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moldova's pro-European President Maia Sandu said on Sunday she intends to run for a second presidential term in late 2024 to bring the issue of the country's European integration to its logical conclusion.
articles.title: Moldova's pro-European president Sandu says she will seek second term

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands gathered in the centre of Belgrade in an anti-government protest on Sunday to demand the annulment of parliamentary and local elections a week ago that international observers said were unfair.
articles.title: Thousands protest in Belgrade to demand annulment of elections
